value.name: title
value.label: Field ID
value.help: Use a unique ID. ID cant be empty. Ex: name

value.name: options
value.label: Options
value.help: Enter each option in a separate line

value.name: upload_allowedtypes
value.label: Allowed File Types
value.help: Enter the allowed file types, separated by a comma (jpg, gif, pdf, etc).

value.name: recaptcha_type
value.label: reCaptcha Type
value.help: for Invisible reCaptcha please configure the plugin.

value.name: captcha_error
value.label: Captcha error message
value.value: Invalid captcha code. Please try again or refresh the page.
value.default: Invalid captcha code. Please try again or refresh the page.

schema.name: recaptcha_type
schema.label: reCaptcha Type
schema.help: for Invisible reCaptcha please configure the plugin.

schema.name: captcha_error
schema.label: Captcha error message
schema.value: Invalid captcha code. Please try again or refresh the page.
schema.default: Invalid captcha code. Please try again or refresh the page.

general.name: form_action_after_submit
general.label: Actions After Submit
general.help: Add actions that will be performed after a visitor submits the form (e.g. send an email notification). Choosing an action will add its setting below.

value.name: actions
value.label: Add Action
value.help: After form submit actions

schema.name: actions
schema.label: Add Action
schema.help: After form submit actions

value.name: email_content
value.label: Email Content
value.help: By default, all form fields are sent via shortcode [all-fields]. Want to customize sent fields? Copy the shortcode that appears inside the field and paste it above.

value.name: email_help
value.help: For beautiful output, use any HTML email template here. This support raw html codes. Use the shortcode properly.

value.name: email_to
value.label: To
value.help: Email To

value.name: reply_to
value.label: Reply To
value.help: Email from. If from users input, then field name email will be used

value.name: email_cc
value.label: Cc
value.help: Separate emails with comma

value.name: email_bcc
value.label: BCc
value.help: Separate emails with comma

value.name: icon
value.label: Icon
value.help: Icon will visible left to the title

schema.name: icon
schema.label: Icon
schema.help: Icon will visible left to the title

value.name: sticky_animation
value.label: Sticky Animation
value.help: Add an animation in order to have the sticky element reappear smoothly.

value.name: sticky_bottom
value.label: Sticky Bottom
value.help: Bind the sticky behavior to a specific element, so that it disappears after scrolling past that point of the page.

value.name: sticky_show_on_up
value.label: Sticky on scroll up
value.help: You can make the sticky element show only when scrolling up to save space. Together with an animation, this makes for a very smooth experience.

value.name: sticky_media
value.label: Responsive
value.help: The element will be sticky from the specified viewport width and upwards, but not below. Only numbers allowed.

value.name: sticky_offset
value.label: Offset
value.help: You can position the element below the viewport edge.

schema.name: sticky_animation
schema.label: Sticky Animation
schema.help: Add an animation in order to have the sticky element reappear smoothly.

schema.name: sticky_bottom

schema.name: sticky_media

value.name: animation_repeat
value.label: Animation Repeat
value.help: Applies animation every time the element is in view

value.name: animation_delay
value.label: Animation Delay
value.help: Delay time in ms

value.name: id
value.label: Css ID
value.help: Add your custom ID WITHOUT the '#'. eg - my-id

value.name: class
value.label: Css Class
value.help: Add your custom classes WITHOUT the dot and seperate by space. eg - first-class another-class

value.name: acl
value.label: Access Control
value.help: Joomla Access Control List
